summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing the need for photos of hard drives (specifically Seagate path 100 drives) to support a search warrant application. The emails involve coordination between an FBI Special Agent and a NYPD Detective/FBI Task Force member regarding forensic evidence collection.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD Detective, FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: NYPD detective assigned to the FBI task force who is requesting photos of hard drives for a warrant and needs approval to send the warrant to a judge.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Forensic examiner who took photos of some hard drives but not the specific Seagate drives in question; coordinating a call to discuss the evidence.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: FBI Special Agent, New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: FBI Special Agent requesting photos of specific hard drives (IBes 29,30,32) and seeking to coordinate a call to review the warrant.

connections.person2: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: Collaborating on forensic evidence collection for a warrant, with the detective requesting photos from the examiner.

connections.person2: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: Coordinating a call to discuss forensic photos and warrant review related to hard drive evidence.
Both are law enforcement officials working on the same case, with the detective needing approval from the agent's team to proceed with a warrant.

events.title: Coordination for Hard Drive Photo Evidence
events.description: Email exchange between FBI and NYPD task force members regarding obtaining photos of hard drives (Seagate path 100 drives) to support a search warrant application.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

keyFacts: The document is an internal FBI email chain dated October 26, 2020, discussing forensic evidence related to hard drives.
The emails reference '9 Seagate path 100 hard drives' and specific drives labeled 'IBes 29,30,32' as subjects of photographic evidence needed for a warrant.
A Detective from the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force is seeking approval to send a warrant to a judge and needs forensic photos to proceed.
The NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner indicates they did not take photos of the specific hard drives in question, highlighting a gap in evidence collection.
The document is marked as 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER,' indicating restricted access to its contents.
